conclusion: Consider power, collision, and deflection effects to determine final positions of A and B.
Cars A and B are moving towards each other in the same direction.
Cars have the same power since they are moving towards each other in the same direction.
A and B will collide head-on at the point where they are closest to each other.
Deflection effect is not visible in the image.
Deflection depends on materials, design, and surface in real-world scenarios.
Assume cars are made of plastic and surface is smooth, making deflection unlikely.
Car A will stop at the point closest to B, at the center of the collision.
Car B will stop at the point closest to A, at the center of the collision.
Final positions where A and B will stop are at the center of the collision.
